messages.message:
HI @vp, is there any way where we can check the actual request details along with it’s payload when it’s coming to Instabase for triggering the ibsolution.
Team is facing one issue when the upstream service is triggering the request, but output is not written in the output dir but according to them they seem to be passing it
cc: @Deeksha @Hannah

Hey @Shubham, there is no logging as I could see in the source of gateway(api-server, previously api-server-apps) that you could enable to know the payload, unfortunately. Most you could do is to trace the /run call in api-server and nginx log(no productive to search for the payload, only will determine the /run call landed). Also if you are getting the uuid back, you can try tracing it on jaeger through /run operation and api-server services to see if that helps. At same point of time, check on the file-tservice log as well to see if there is file folder creation problem
